application_instruction: This role may also be located in our Playa Vista, CA campus.
description:
You're an avid problem solver who shares our seriousness about security and our commitment to confidentiality. You believe no task is too small or too big to take on, enjoy providing a high quality of customer service, and know the ins and outs of Google, its teams, and resources. You’ll provide the organizational and analytical skills necessary to ensure investigations are handled in a timely and effective manner. You’ll collaborate with cross-functional partners to support the investigation team by developing innovative security strategies, leads on new and ongoing investigations and help navigate roadblocks.

From keeping Googlers safe and secure to managing disruptive events, the ability to anticipate, deter, detect, and act are the pillars of Google’s Global Security and Resilience Services (GSRS) team. As a member of GSRS you will help develop a culture where safety, security and resiliency are integrated into every facet of Google, including the creative process. You will help us continually identify, evaluate and monitor enterprise risks that could affect business activities and provide business leaders the information they need to make critical decisions. You'll collaborate with cross-functional teams to create innovative strategies and develop programs that drive sustainable effectiveness.
eeo: At Google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. Google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form.
qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • Bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.
  • 1 year of experience working in an administrative, investigative or legal support role with a focus on customer service and client management.

Preferred qualifications:

  • Experience supporting investigations including criminal, human resources, legal or safety incidents
  • Experience in using Plx (writing script queries, creating dashboards) and a knack for solving problems and influencing people
  • Experience in supply chain
  • Strong interest in and experience with process improvement
  • Very strong command of Google Apps and trend analysis
  • Detail-oriented with strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to multitask in a fast paced environment
responsibilities:
• Coordinate the intake process for new investigations, entering cases into security database
  • “Unpack” the issue, figure out a gameplan, connect with the appropriate teams and establish networks of individuals who can provide additional support and information
  • Seek opportunities and work to improve investigative processes continuously
  • Work with cross-functional team members to obtain pertinent information, seeing minor issues through to completion
  • Conduct trend analysis using available databases and historical information, and conduct audits to ensure team has clean data
title: Investigative Analyst, Global Security and Resilience Services
